articles.content: President Donald Trump's aides have faced internal upheaval after the midterms and are preparing for a likely staff reckoning with high profile exits. | Nicholas Kamm/AFP/Getty Images Bottled-up hostility in President Donald Trumps administration flowed to th… [+7936 chars]

articles.author: soverly@politico.com (Steven Overly)
articles.title: Amazon’s enemies swarm as its D.C. clout swells
articles.description: Bezos’ presence in Northern Virginia and New York will enhance his company’s sway. But Amazon is increasingly drawing attacks from critics and rivals.
articles.content: New York Rep.-elect Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez decried the "race-to-the-bottom competition" for corporate favors for companies like Amazon. | Mary Schwalm/AP Photo Amazons triumphant announcement Tuesday of its moves into the Beltway and New York City called at… [+8506 chars]

articles.author: kcheney@politico.com (Kyle Cheney)
articles.title: Pelosi cranks up campaign to win over freshmen
articles.description: The California Democrat is using every trick in her book to take back the speakership.
articles.content: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi secretly showed up to the Congressional Progressive Caucuss freshman orientation session on Monday to try to ingratiate herself with about 20 members-elect in attendance. | Jose Luis Magana/AP Photo Nancy Pelosis wooing of t… [+9095 chars]

articles.author: Burgess Everett
articles.title: Parties barrel toward clash over Mueller's job security
articles.description: If the two sides can't come to terms on the special counsel and Trump's border wall, part of the government will shut down.
articles.content: "Is [Senate Minority Leader Chuck] Schumer going to shut down the government over border security? Strikes me as a bad idea, said Senate Majority Whip John Cornyn (R-Texas) when asked about special counsel Rober Mueller and the border wall. | Drew Angerer/Get… [+6621 chars]
